result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvin Lamont Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:03 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Paul Hasenstab not present.  Statement by defendant.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court will set for probation review hearing the same time as the other case.

Court adjourned at 1:06 p.m.
Probation review hearing on August 13, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

4:02 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Scott Blader as special prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing argument by Atty Blader.  Sentencing argument by Atty Mares.  Statement by Atty Blader.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 2 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-8 months county jail to commence within 60 days, with huber and out of county service
-Court costs
-AODA and any follow-up
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

COUNT 3 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-135 days county jail to commence within 60 days, with huber and out of county service
-Court costs
-AODA and any follow-up
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Jail is to be concurrent to each other.

Defendant is to receive credit for one day served.

Sentencing hearing at 09-01-2015 04:00 pm

4:20 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Scott Blader as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Blader.  Statement by Atty Mares - requests an adjournment.  No objection by Atty Blader.  Court will set for Sentencing Hearing on September 1, 2015 at 4:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 4:2 p.m.
Criminal Summons and Complaint from Fond du lac County (2014CF631)
AMENDED
Sentencing hearing at 08-18-2015 03:45 pm

3:43 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Scott Blader as Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Blader - a Fond du Lac case 2014CF631, which is count 4 of the amended information will be read-in.  Further statement by Atty Blader, defendant will plea to count 2 & 3 of the amended information.  Atty Mares concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Statement by the Court - does not have the criminal complaint from Fond du lac.  Court questions regarding Traffic citations.  Statement by Atty Blader - TR cases are to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Mares concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Atty Mares and defendant have received a copy of the amended information.  Court goes over maximum penalties.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2 & 3 of the amended information.  Court orders counts 1 & 4 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the TR citations be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court does not order a PSI.  Court orders matter be set for Sentencing on August 18, 2015 at 3:45 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:55 p.m.
